alert.note: Alert for Dade (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:20PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Dade County through 345 PM EDT... At 320 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Bridgeport, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Trenton, Stephensville, New England, Morganville, Hooker, Cloudland Canyon State Park, Cole City, Wildwood and Rising Fawn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northwestern Georgia.
